intro: Amerimnon gardnerianum, commonly known as the Gardner's spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features upright, branched stems and produces small, clustered yellow flowers. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
